data.Sentence_cn: 实验证明，儿童在很小的时候就可以开始学习游泳。
data.Sentence: Experiments have proved that children can be instructed in swimming at a very early age.

data.Sentence_cn: 在洛杉矶的一个特设的游泳池里，
data.Sentence: At a special swimming pool in Los Angeles,

data.Sentence_cn: 孩子们甚至在还没有学会走路时就已经能熟练地在水下屏住呼吸了。
data.Sentence: children become expert at holding their breath under water even before they can walk.

data.Sentence_cn: 两个月的婴儿并未显得不愿意入水。
data.Sentence: Babies of two months old do not appear to be reluctant to enter the water.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们很快便适应了游泳，以致能捡起池底的物品。
data.Sentence: It is not long before they are so accustomed to swimming that they can pick up weights from the floor of the pool.

data.Sentence_cn: 这些幼小的游泳运动员非常喜爱的一种游戏是水下三轮车比赛。
data.Sentence: A game that is very popular with these young swimmers is the underwater tricycle race.

data.Sentence_cn: 三轮车并排放在7英尺深的游泳池底上。
data.Sentence: Tricycles are lined up on the floor of the pool seven feet under water.

data.Sentence_cn: 孩子们比赛看谁先到达游泳池的另一端。
data.Sentence: The children compete against each other to reach the other end of the pool.

data.Sentence_cn: 很多孩子用脚蹬车，但多数孩子更愿意推或是拉着三轮车。
data.Sentence: Many pedal their tricycles, but most of them prefer to push or drag them.

data.Sentence_cn: 有些孩子能够跑完游泳池的全长而不用露出水面换气。
data.Sentence: Some children can cover the whole length of the pool without coming up for breath even once.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们将来是否能成为奥林匹克的冠军，这只能由时间来作出回答。
data.Sentence: Whether they will ever become future Olympic champions, only time will tell.

data.Sentence_cn: 与此同时，他们对我们中的那些游不了5码就已喘不过气来的人应该是种鼓舞。
data.Sentence: Meanwhile, they should encourage those among us who cannot swim five yards before they are gasping for air.
